name: houston flanagan
text: Great place helped get me back on the right track of life would recommend for anybody looking to recover and find get closer to God very friendly people and everybody treats you not just as a client but as family I love great expectations of woodville

name: Amanda Hastings
text: My niece checked herself in here bc she knew she needed help, not bc she was in any trouble. She was kicked out for being gay, she was told to get her heart right or get out.  While I do not agree with her lifestyle, I do know that Jesus came for the sinners and He came out of love and tells us to do ALL things out of love.  The actions and words that were spoke to my niece by the man that calls himself the preacher was not acts of love, compassion, or trying to draw sinner to Christ.  His sermon could of been what God used to reach her, but instead he let his flesh influence his actions pushing her farther from not only a recovery, but from Jesus as well.  (by not even allowing her in the church!)

name: Sherry Richey
text: This place gave me a second chance of forgiveness, a second chance of being a mother,and a chance of knowing my higher power.This place has a spiritual loving family. They all hold a special place in my heart...

name: Marla Brewer
text:
A Church Cemetery that serves the people of the community, it holds my family history. My Grandmother's
Grandfather is buried only a few feet from her, as is her only child, my father. Although the church holds a Cemetery clean up day annually, it's the responsibility of the family to maintain their plots. You can feel the love that still exists in families as you walk through and admire the flowers and neatly maintained graves.
